function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reliance on globalization and economic growth as drivers of green investment and sustainable development","Impact":"Excessive reliance may lead to increased global transportation, trade, and economic activities that promote the spread of contagious diseases","Mitigation":"Diversifying investment sources, promoting local and regional economies, and reducing dependence on global supply chains","Technologies":"Local production technologies, supply chain management tools, and economic forecasting models","People":"Global population, especially those in highly interconnected regions","Owner":"Government, international organizations, and private sector"},{"Description":"Accidental positive effects on the environment and natural ecosystems due to government-imposed measures","Impact":"Loss of these positive effects may result in environmental degradation and heightened vulnerability to contagious diseases","Mitigation":"Implementing sustainable policies, supporting green technology development, and investing in ecological conservation","Technologies":"Renewable energy technologies, sustainable agriculture practices, and conservation monitoring tools","People":"Local communities, environmentalists, and wildlife conservationists","Owner":"Government, environmental organizations, and private sector"},{"Description":"Thrusting business as usual into overdrive for economic recovery efforts","Impact":"Increased economic activities without regard for environmental and public health considerations may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases and exacerbate environmental degradation","Mitigation":"Adopting sustainable business practices, integrating public health considerations into economic policies, and promoting low-carbon technologies","Technologies":"Health monitoring systems, sustainable business management tools, and green energy solutions","People":"Workers, consumers, and communities affected by economic activities","Owner":"Businesses, government, and public health agencies"}]}
